Resetting a Filter

In StarTeam, you can apply a filter, then rearrange the data on the upper pane or apply a new query. Doing this places an asterisk in front of the filter's name, showing that it has been changed.

After looking at the new data, you can then reset the filter as it was originally defined on the server, which removes the asterisk.

To restore (reset) a filter to its original definition:

  1. Do one of the following when the filter in the list box has changed:

    • Right-click a column header on the upper pane, then select Reset Current Settings from the context menu.

    • Select Filters > Reset Current Settings from the component or context menu.

    The system asks: Reset filter: Filter>?

  2. Click OK. This action resets the filter and removes the asterisk.
